result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A. Klein

records.addlTxt:
3:21 PM Defendant Jacob A. Klein appeared by video.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Jacob A. Klein.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement received.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:29 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:09 pm - Defendant Jacob A. Klein in court.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carl Knepel in court for Jacob Klein, appearing specially for Attorney Luke Harrison. Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin.  An adjournment is being requested so that Atty. Harrison can appear with his client.  Defendant waives the time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:07 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob A. Klein in court. Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess methamphetamine and possession of drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
